text: One Hundred Poems From the Chinese is a collection of translations of Chinese poetry by Kenneth Rexroth, first published in 1956. The book is in two parts: the first contains 35 poems by Du Fu, while the second consists of works by assorted Song dynasty poets. The book actually contains over one-hundred poems.Rexroth, back cover ==See also== *Classical Chinese poetry ==Notes== ==References== *Rexroth, Kenneth, 1970. Love and the Turning Year: One Hundred More Poems from the Chinese. New York: New Directions. Category:Chinese poetry collections
title: One Hundred Poems from the Chinese
